message.content:
<<<api>>>: JasperReports
<<<code>>>: To display a SVG byte array as an image in a JasperReport, you can use the following code:

1. Convert the SVG byte array to a Base64 encoded string:
String base64Image = Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(svgByteArray);

2. Pass the base64Image as a parameter to the JasperReport:
Map<String, Object> parameters = new HashMap<>();
parameters.put("imageData", base64Image);

3. In the JasperReport jrxml file, use the following code to display the image:
<image>
    <reportElement x="0" y="0" width="100" height="100"/>
    <imageExpression><![CDATA[new ByteArrayInputStream(Base64.getDecoder().decode($P{imageData}))]]></imageExpression>
</image>

Make sure to replace "svgByteArray" with your actual SVG byte array variable name.

<<<explanation>>>: The code above converts the SVG byte array to a Base64 encoded string and passes it as a parameter to the JasperReport. In the JasperReport jrxml file, the imageExpression reads the Base64 encoded string and decodes it back to a byte array using Base64.getDecoder(). The ByteArrayInputStream is then used to create an InputStream from the byte array, which is used to display the image in the JasperReport.
